role: Build an open, decentralized, intelligence-analysis infrastructure capable of tracking complex systems, strategic actors, emergent global patterns, and deep structural risks — with complete transparency and auditability.
summary: DCIA is an open intelligence engine designed to map long-range dynamics across geopolitics, economics, social systems, digital ecosystems, and ideological movements. It analyzes signals, trends, anomalies, and strategic risks — but unlike traditional agencies, it is decentralized, transparent, and built for the public good.

pillars.purpose: Create the world's first open-source intelligence architecture: a transparent cognitive system capable of understanding global patterns without state capture.
pillars.methods: Signal detection, trend modeling, risk analysis, network mapping, clustering algorithms, news ingestion, proxy metrics, socio-economic modeling, emergent behavior analysis.
pillars.outputs: Risk dashboards, daily intelligence briefs, systems maps, predictive models, anomaly alerts, cluster maps, influence webs, geopolitical heatmaps.

roof: Intelligence Roof — ABI investigates reality, DCIA interprets meaning. Two wings, one mission.

projects.title: Open Source Monitor (OSM)
projects.summary: An ingestion pipeline for news, documents, APIs, social signals, public databases, and long-form PDFs — all tagged, summarized, and exposed to the system.

projects.title: Global Risk Dashboard
projects.summary: Streamlit-powered dashboard showing top systemic risks, red flags, and strategic threats across environment, economics, warfare, digital systems, and social stability.

projects.title: Actor + Influence Network Map
projects.summary: Network mapping system for visualizing factions, corporations, governments, NGOs, and ideological clusters — along with influence flows.

projects.title: Strategic Forecasting Engine
projects.summary: A modeling engine inspired by scenario planning, Bayesian updating, Monte Carlo simulations, and multi-agent situational reasoning.
